text: Information Retrieval (IR) is the science of searching for information within large collections of documents. Key components include web crawling, efficient indexing, and various retrieval models. Building an inverted index is crucial for fast keyword-based searches and ranking.

The James Webb Space Telescope continues to deliver breathtaking images of distant galaxies, offering unprecedented insights into the early universe. Its infrared capabilities allow astronomers to peer through cosmic dust, revealing star formation regions and exoplanet atmospheres, vastly expanding our knowledge.

Machine learning algorithms are increasingly applied in bioinformatics for tasks such as protein folding prediction, gene sequencing analysis, and drug discovery. Deep learning models, in particular, show promise in identifying complex patterns in biological data, accelerating research.
